ground_truth: She sits hunched and clutching her chest where she was shot. Marius squats down and puts his arm around her. Drops of rain glisten on her pale face. Her eyes close. She reaches out to touch his face. Marius gazes at Eponine. Her hand drops to her side. Young Gavroche watches, a tear rolling down his cheek. Marius gently kisses Eponine's brow. Enjolras is also watching, grave-faced. Enjolras squats down. Marius helps him pick Eponine up and carry her away. Marius stares at Cosette's letter with tear-filled eyes. Holding her letter, he goes over to Gavroche. Gavroche hurries up a dark stairway to Valjean and Cosette's lodgings. Gavroche pulls it back, and Valjean offers a coin. Gavroche stops. Gavroche goes. Valjean reads the letter, frowning. Valjean looks up to the heavens. Valjean looks around, thoughtfully. Outside, Valjean steals a dead soldier's jacket, peaked cap, and musket. Disguised as a soldier, he makes his way to the barricade where students keep watch. He takes off his cap. He's let in, and guns are aimed at him. Javert has a noose around his neck. Valjean looks up. Valjean shoots a soldier off a rooftop. Gavroche hands Valjean a pistol. Beaten and bloody, Javert stares at Valjean slacked faced. He kneels with his hands tied and the noose around his neck. Valjean pulls his head up to face him. They stare into each other's eyes for a moment. Valjean hauls Javert to his feet and marches him to a dark corner. Valjean holds up a dagger. They stand facing each other. Valjean cuts the ropes binding his wrists. Javert walks off and turns back. Valjean aims his pistol. Valjean walks towards him. Javert frowns incredulously. Javert walks off. Valjean aims the pistol. He fires into a wall. Javert stops and looks back then heads off into the dark. Valjean goes back to join the others. They sit around regarding him with serious expressions. Valjean nods. Enjolras addresses the group. Marius stops adjusting the barricade and sits with the others. The wine is passed round. Frowning, Valjean listens to Marius. Marius sits clutching Cosette's handkerchief. Standing nearby, Valjean wears a fraught serious expression. He leans in a doorway. Valjean looks at Marius. Valjean stands beside the sleeping Marius. Marius stares at Enjolras fearfully. Everyone looks thoughtful. Soldier shoots at Gavroche who has climbed through the barricade. Gavroche is hit. Gavroche is shot again and flops on his back, dead. One of the students goes to pick him up and carries him back behind the barricade. Marius gives him cover with his musket. An army officer watches. Behind the barricade, Gavroche is laid on the ground. Enjolras looks around heavy brown. As cannons are rolled forward, the students shoot down a few soldiers.

He's allowed in, and firearms are targeted at him. Javert has a loop around his neck. Valjean glances up. Valjean shoots a trooper off a rooftop. Gavroche hands Valjean a handgun. Valjean targets the handgun. He discharges into a partition. Javert halts and glances back then proceeds off into the dim. Valjean goes back to reunite with the others. They sit around regarding him with grave expressions. Valjean nods. Enjolras addresses the assembly. Marius pauses adjusting the barrier and sits with the others. The wine is circulated. test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: She sits hunched, clutching her chest where she was shot. Marius squats, putting his arm around her. Rain glistens on her pale face. Her eyes close as she reaches to touch his face. Marius gazes at Eponine, her hand dropping to her side. Young Gavroche watches, a tear on his cheek. Marius kisses Eponine's brow. Enjolras watches gravely, squatting to help Marius carry Eponine away. Marius stares at Cosette's letter, tears in his eyes, and goes to Gavroche. Gavroche hurries to Valjean and Cosette's lodgings, pulling back as Valjean offers a coin. Valjean reads the letter, frowning, then looks to the heavens thoughtfully. Outside, Valjean steals a dead soldier's jacket, cap, and musket. Disguised, he reaches the barricade where students watch. He removes his cap and is let in, guns aimed at him. Javert has a noose around his neck. Valjean shoots a soldier off a rooftop. Gavroche hands him a pistol. Beaten, Javert stares at Valjean, kneeling with hands tied. Valjean lifts his head, they lock eyes, then cuts Javert's ropes. Javert walks off, turning back as Valjean aims his pistol, firing into a wall. Javert stops, looks back, then leaves. Valjean rejoins the others, who regard him seriously. Valjean nods as Enjolras addresses the group. Marius stops adjusting the barricade, sitting with the others. Wine is passed around. Frowning, Valjean listens to Marius, who clutches Cosette's handkerchief. Valjean stands nearby, serious, leaning in a doorway. He looks at Marius, then stands beside the sleeping Marius. Marius stares fearfully at Enjolras. Everyone is thoughtful. A soldier shoots at Gavroche, who climbs through the barricade. Gavroche is hit, shot again, and dies. A student carries him back behind the barricade, Marius providing cover. An army officer watches. Behind the barricade, Gavroche is laid on the ground. Enjolras looks around, heavy with sorrow. As cannons roll forward, students shoot down a few soldiers.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: She sits hunched over, clutching her chest tightly where the bullet struck her. Marius, with a look of deep concern, squats down beside her and gently wraps his arm around her shoulders. Tiny drops of rain glisten like diamonds on her pale, lifeless face. Her eyes slowly close, and with a trembling hand, she reaches out to touch his face tenderly. Marius gazes intently at Eponine, his expression filled with sorrow. Her hand falls limply to her side. Young Gavroche watches the scene unfold, a single tear rolling down his cheek, leaving a glistening trail. Marius leans in and gently kisses Eponine's brow with a soft, lingering touch. Enjolras, standing nearby, observes the scene with a grave expression on his face. He then squats down beside them. Together, Marius and Enjolras carefully lift Eponine and carry her away with great care. Marius, his eyes brimming with tears, stares at Cosette's letter, holding it tightly. He approaches Gavroche, who quickly hurries up a dark, narrow stairway leading to Valjean and Cosette's lodgings. Gavroche pulls back, and Valjean offers him a coin, causing Gavroche to pause momentarily before continuing on his way. Valjean reads the letter, his brow furrowed in thought. He looks up to the heavens, seeking guidance, and then glances around thoughtfully. Outside, Valjean discreetly steals a dead soldier's jacket, peaked cap, and musket. Disguised as a soldier, he makes his way to the barricade where the vigilant students keep watch. He removes his cap, and they let him in, though guns are aimed at him cautiously. Javert stands with a noose around his neck. Valjean looks up at him. Valjean shoots a soldier off a rooftop with precision. Gavroche hands Valjean a pistol. Beaten and bloody, Javert stares at Valjean with a slackened expression. He kneels with his hands tied and the noose still around his neck. Valjean pulls his head up to meet his gaze. They lock eyes for a moment, a silent understanding passing between them. Valjean hauls Javert to his feet and marches him to a dark corner. Valjean holds up a dagger, and they stand facing each other. Valjean cuts the ropes binding Javert's wrists. Javert walks off, then turns back. Valjean aims his pistol at him. Valjean walks towards him, and Javert frowns incredulously. Javert walks off again. Valjean aims the pistol once more and fires into a wall. Javert stops, looks back, then heads off into the dark night. Valjean returns to join the others, who sit around regarding him with serious expressions. Valjean nods in acknowledgment. Enjolras addresses the group with authority. Marius stops adjusting the barricade and sits with the others. The wine is passed around, and Valjean, frowning, listens intently to Marius. Marius sits, clutching Cosette's handkerchief tightly. Standing nearby, Valjean wears a fraught, serious expression as he leans in a doorway. Valjean looks at Marius with concern. Valjean stands beside the sleeping Marius, watching over him. Marius stares at Enjolras fearfully. Everyone looks thoughtful, their minds heavy with the weight of the situation. A soldier shoots at Gavroche, who has bravely climbed through the barricade. Gavroche is hit, and then shot again, flopping onto his back, lifeless. One of the students rushes to pick him up and carries him back behind the barricade. Marius provides cover with his musket. An army officer watches the scene unfold. Behind the barricade, Gavroche is laid gently on the ground. Enjolras looks around, his expression heavy with sorrow. As cannons are rolled forward, the students bravely shoot down a few soldiers, determined to hold their ground.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: Her posture is bent forward as she sits hunched over, clutching her chest with desperation where the bullet has cruelly struck her. Marius, wearing an expression of deep concern and worry etched across his face, moves down into a squat beside her and gently wraps an arm around her shoulders. Tiny droplets of rain adorn her pale, lifeless face, glistening like precious diamonds. Her eyes begin to slowly close, and with a hand that trembles with effort, she reaches out to tenderly touch his face. Marius gazes intently at Eponine, his expression filled with profound sorrow and grief. Her hand falls limply to her side, signaling her departure from this world. Young Gavroche stands watching the tragic scene unfold before him, a single tear rolling down his cheek, leaving behind a glistening trail. Marius leans in closely and gently kisses Eponine's brow with a soft, lingering touch full of unspoken love. Enjolras, who is standing nearby, observes the scene with a grave expression on his face, feeling the weight of the moment. He then lowers himself into a squat beside them. Together, Marius and Enjolras carefully lift Eponine and carry her away with great care and tenderness. Marius, his eyes brimming with tears of despair, holds Cosette's letter tightly. He approaches Gavroche, who quickly hurries up a dark and narrow stairway leading to Valjean and Cosette's lodgings. Gavroche briefly pauses when Valjean offers him a coin, but then continues along his way. Valjean furrows his brow as he reads the letter, deep in thought. He looks up to the heavens, seeking guidance, and then glances around thoughtfully. Outside, Valjean discreetly steals a dead soldier's jacket, peaked cap, and musket, transforming himself into the guise of a soldier. Using this disguise, he makes his way to the barricade where the vigilant students maintain their watch. As he removes his cap, they allow him to enter, though they caution him by aiming their guns warily. Javert stands there with a noose ominously around his neck. Valjean looks up at him. With precise aim, Valjean shoots a soldier off a rooftop. Gavroche, always quick to act, offers Valjean a pistol. Beaten and bloody, Javert stares slackly at Valjean. He kneels, his hands tied and the noose still ominously in place around his neck. Valjean pulls his head up to meet his unwavering gaze. They lock eyes for a moment, sharing a silent understanding. Valjean lifts Javert to his feet and marches him into a dark corner. Holding up a dagger, Valjean faces Javert. He then cuts the ropes binding Javert's wrists. Javert begins to walk off before turning back. Valjean aims his pistol at him. As Valjean steps towards him, Javert frowns in disbelief. Javert walks off again, and Valjean, with deliberate intent, fires the pistol into a wall. Javert stops, looks back one last time, then disappears into the dark night. Valjean returns to join the others, who regard him with serious expressions. He nods in acknowledgment of their unspoken questions. Enjolras addresses the group with authoritative words. Marius stops adjusting the barricade and sits with the others. The wine is passed around, and Valjean, frowning intently, listens to Marius. Marius sits, clutching Cosette's handkerchief tightly. Nearby, Valjean stands with a fraught, serious expression as he leans in a doorway, watching over Marius with concern. Valjean stands beside the sleeping Marius, keeping watch over him. Marius stares at Enjolras with fear flickering in his eyes. Everyone looks thoughtful, their minds weighed down by the gravity of their situation. A soldier shoots at Gavroche, who bravely climbs through the barricade. Gavroche is struck, and as he is shot again, he flops onto his back, lifeless. One of the students quickly rushes to pick him up, carrying him back behind the barricade with urgency. Marius provides covering fire with his musket. An army officer views the unfolding scene from a distance. Behind the barricade, Gavroche is laid gently on the ground. Enjolras looks around, his expression heavy with deep sorrow. As cannons are rolled forward, the students courageously shoot down a few soldiers, steadfast in their determination to hold their ground.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: She sits hunched over, her body curled inward as she clutches her chest where the bullet has pierced her, her fingers pressing against the wound in a futile attempt to stem the bleeding. Marius, with a look of deep concern etched on his face, lowers himself into a squat beside her, his knees bending as he reaches out to wrap his arm around her shoulders, offering what little comfort he can. The rain continues to fall, each drop catching the light as it lands on her pale face, creating a glistening sheen that highlights her pallor. Her eyelids flutter closed, a sign of her waning strength, and with a trembling hand, she reaches out, her fingers brushing against Marius's face in a tender, final gesture. Marius gazes intently at Eponine, his eyes filled with a mixture of sorrow and affection, as her hand falls limply to her side, the last of her energy spent. Nearby, young Gavroche watches the scene unfold, his small face contorted with emotion as a single tear escapes, tracing a path down his cheek. Marius leans forward, pressing a gentle kiss to Eponine's brow, a silent farewell. Enjolras, standing a short distance away, observes the scene with a grave expression, his features set in a somber mask. He moves closer, lowering himself into a squat beside Marius, and together they carefully lift Eponine's lifeless body, each taking a side as they carry her away with a shared sense of loss. Marius, his heart heavy, turns his attention to Cosette's letter, his eyes brimming with tears as he reads the words that connect him to her. Clutching the letter tightly, he approaches Gavroche, who, understanding the urgency, quickly ascends a dark stairway leading to Valjean and Cosette's lodgings. Upon reaching the door, Gavroche pulls it open, and Valjean, standing inside, offers him a coin in gratitude. Gavroche pauses momentarily before accepting the coin and then departs, leaving Valjean to read the letter. As Valjean's eyes scan the page, his brow furrows in concentration, and he looks up to the heavens, seeking guidance. His gaze shifts around the room thoughtfully, formulating a plan. Outside, Valjean stealthily approaches a fallen soldier, deftly removing the jacket, peaked cap, and musket, disguising himself as one of them. Now in uniform, he makes his way to the barricade where the students stand vigil, removing his cap as a sign of respect. The students, recognizing him, allow him entry, though they remain on guard, their weapons trained on him. Javert, captured and subdued, stands with a noose around his neck, his expression one of defiance. Valjean looks up, assessing the situation, and in a swift motion, he shoots a soldier perched on a rooftop, eliminating the threat. Gavroche, ever resourceful, hands Valjean a pistol, his small hands steady despite the chaos. Javert, beaten and bloody, stares at Valjean with a slackened face, his spirit momentarily broken. He kneels, his hands bound and the noose still in place, as Valjean approaches, lifting Javert's head to meet his gaze. They lock eyes, a silent understanding passing between them. Valjean hauls Javert to his feet, marching him to a secluded corner where they stand face to face. Valjean produces a dagger, cutting the ropes that bind Javert's wrists, granting him freedom. Javert, momentarily stunned, turns to leave but pauses, glancing back at Valjean, who raises his pistol, aiming it with intent. Valjean steps forward, closing the distance, and Javert frowns, incredulous at the turn of events. Javert resumes his departure, and Valjean fires the pistol into a wall, the shot echoing in the night. Javert stops, looking back one last time before disappearing into the darkness. Valjean returns to the group, who regard him with serious expressions, their eyes filled with questions. Valjean nods, acknowledging their unspoken concerns, as Enjolras addresses the assembly, rallying them with his words. Marius, having paused his work on the barricade, joins the others, sitting among them as the wine is passed around, a moment of camaraderie amidst the tension. Valjean, frowning, listens intently to Marius, who sits clutching Cosette's handkerchief, a token of their love. Standing nearby, Valjean's face is marked by a fraught, serious expression as he leans against a doorway, his mind racing with thoughts. He looks at Marius, who stands beside the sleeping young man, his gaze filled with a mixture of fear and determination. Marius, in turn, stares at Enjolras, his eyes wide with apprehension as the weight of their situation settles in. The group sits in thoughtful silence, each member lost in their own reflections. Suddenly, a soldier fires at Gavroche, who has bravely climbed through the barricade, his small form silhouetted against the chaos. Gavroche is hit, the impact knocking him back, and as he is shot again, he flops onto his back, lifeless. One of the students rushes forward, lifting Gavroche's body with care and carrying him back behind the barricade, where Marius provides cover with his musket, firing at the advancing soldiers. An army officer watches the scene unfold, his expression unreadable. Behind the barricade, Gavroche is laid gently on the ground, his youthful face now at peace. Enjolras surveys the scene, his expression heavy with the weight of their losses. As cannons are rolled forward, the students respond with determination, shooting down several soldiers in a desperate bid to hold their ground.

test_cases.description: She sits hunched, clutching her chest where she was shot, as Marius squats beside her, comforting her with an arm around her shoulders. Rain glistens on her pale face as her eyes close, and she reaches out to touch his face before her hand falls to her side. Young Gavroche watches, a tear rolling down his cheek, while Marius gently kisses Eponine's brow. Enjolras, observing gravely, joins Marius to help carry Eponine away. After a brief exchange, Valjean reads the letter, frowning thoughtfully, before donning a dead soldier's jacket, cap, and musket to disguise himself. Valjean confronts a beaten Javert, cutting his bindings and allowing him to leave. Javert walks off, and Valjean fires a pistol into a wall, watching as Javert disappears into the dark. Valjean returns to the group, nodding as Enjolras addresses them. Marius, clutching Cosette's handkerchief, sits with the others, while Valjean listens intently. As Marius stares fearfully at Enjolras, the group sits in thoughtful silence. Gavroche, climbing through the barricade, is shot and killed. A student retrieves his body, and Marius provides cover with his musket. Behind the barricade, Gavroche is laid on the ground as Enjolras looks around solemnly, and the students continue to fend off advancing soldiers.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: She sits hunched and clutching her chest where she was shot, a wound that echoes the brutal violence of the June Rebellion in Paris. Marius, a student involved in this 1832 uprising, squats down and puts his arm around her. Drops of rain, a constant companion of the Parisian street battles, glisten on her pale face. Her eyes close as she reaches out to touch his face, a gesture reminiscent of the tender connections formed amidst chaos. Marius gazes at Eponine, who had long harbored unrequited love for him. Her hand drops to her side. Young Gavroche, a street-savvy boy embodying the spirit of the French underclass, watches, a tear rolling down his cheek. Marius gently kisses Eponine's brow, an acknowledgment of her sacrifice. Enjolras, the passionate and idealistic leader of the students, is also watching, grave-faced. Enjolras squats down. Marius helps him pick Eponine up and carry her away, showing the somber duties of revolutionaries even amid their struggle. Marius stares at Cosette's letter with tear-filled eyes, yearning for the love and peace it represents. Holding her letter, he goes over to Gavroche. Gavroche, familiar with the labyrinthine streets of Paris, hurries up a dark stairway to Valjean and Cosette's lodgings. Gavroche pulls it back, and Valjean, once a convict and now a man of compassion, offers a coin. Gavroche stops, his streetwise instincts momentarily paused by this unexpected generosity. Gavroche goes. Valjean reads the letter, frowning at the desperate words within. Valjean looks up to the heavens, perhaps seeking guidance or absolution. Valjean looks around, thoughtfully weighing the consequences of his actions. Outside, Valjean steals a dead soldier's jacket, peaked cap, and musket, a disguise necessary to navigate the perilous streets. Disguised as a soldier, he makes his way to the barricade where students keep watch, participating in their last stand. He takes off his cap. He's let in, and guns are aimed at him, a tense reminder of their precarious situation. Javert, the relentless inspector, has a noose around his neck, caught by those he pursued. Valjean looks up, deciding Javert's fate. Valjean shoots a soldier off a rooftop, a reluctant action forced by survival. Gavroche hands Valjean a pistol, a poignant symbol of trust. Beaten and bloody, Javert stares at Valjean slack-faced, his unwavering belief in law confronted by Valjean's mercy. He kneels with his hands tied and the noose around his neck. Valjean pulls his head up to face him. They stare into each other's eyes for a moment, an intense exchange of conflicting morals. Valjean hauls Javert to his feet and marches him to a dark corner. Valjean holds up a dagger. They stand facing each other. Valjean cuts the ropes binding his wrists, offering Javert an unexpected freedom. Javert walks off and turns back, bewildered by the mercy shown to him. Valjean aims his pistol, but Valjean walks towards him, a gesture of trust and resolve. Javert frowns incredulously, struggling with this new reality. Javert walks off. Valjean aims the pistol. He fires into a wall, choosing to spare rather than kill. Javert stops and looks back, then heads off into the dark, changed yet conflicted. Valjean goes back to join the others. They sit around regarding him with serious expressions, the weight of their struggle etched in their faces. Valjean nods, acknowledging the gravity of their circumstances. Enjolras addresses the group, his voice carrying the fervent call for liberty. Marius stops adjusting the barricade and sits with the others, exhausted yet resolute. The wine, a temporary respite from their grim reality, is passed round. Frowning, Valjean listens to Marius, pondering the ideals for which they fight. Marius sits clutching Cosette's handkerchief, a token of hope and love in the darkness. Standing nearby, Valjean wears a fraught serious expression, aware of the imminent danger. He leans in a doorway. Valjean looks at Marius, seeing in him both the hope of youth and the burden of rebellion. Valjean stands beside the sleeping Marius, watching over him like a guardian. Marius stares at Enjolras fearfully, aware of the sacrifice they must make. Everyone looks thoughtful, a heavy silence enveloping them. A soldier shoots at Gavroche, who has climbed through the barricade, his bravery standing out even in the face of danger. Gavroche is hit. Gavroche is shot again and flops on his back, dead, a tragic casualty of their ideals. One of the students goes to pick him up and carries him back behind the barricade, a solemn procession of brotherhood. Marius gives him cover with his musket, a futile defense against the inevitable. An army officer watches, the face of opposing authority unmoved by their plight. Behind the barricade, Gavroche is laid on the ground, a martyr of the youth's fight for justice. Enjolras looks around heavily burdened by the loss and the reality of their dwindling options. As cannons are rolled forward, the students shoot down a few soldiers, their determination indomitable despite the odds.

test_cases.name: Addition (~50%)
test_cases.description: She sits hunched and clutching her chest where she was shot. Marius squats down and puts his arm around her. Drops of rain glisten on her pale face. Her eyes close. She reaches out to touch his face. Marius gazes at Eponine. Her hand drops to her side. Young Gavroche watches a tear rolling down his cheek. Marius gently kisses Eponine's brow. Enjolras is also watching gravefaced. Enjolras squats down. Marius helps him pick Eponine up and carry her away. Marius stares at Cosette's letter with tearfilled eyes. Holding her letter he goes over to Gavroche. Gavroche hurries up a dark stairway to Valjean and Cosette's lodgings. Gavroche pulls it back and Valjean offers a coin. Gavroche stops. Gavroche goes. Valjean reads the letter frowning. Valjean looks up to the heavens. Valjean looks around thoughtfully. Outside. Valjean steals a dead soldier's jacket peaked cap and musket. Disguised as a soldier he makes his way to the barricade where students keep watch. He takes off his cap. He is let in and guns are aimed at him. Javert has a noose around his neck. Valjean looks up. Valjean shoots a soldier off a rooftop. Gavroche hands Valjean a pistol. Beaten and bloody Javert stares at Valjean slacked faced. He kneels with his hands tied and the noose around his neck. Valjean pulls his head up to face him. They stare into each other's eyes for a moment. Valjean hauls Javert to his feet and marches him to a dark corner. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. Valjean holds up a dagger. They stand facing each other. Valjean cuts the ropes binding his wrists. Javert walks off and turns back. Valjean aims his pistol. Valjean walks towards him. Javert frowns incredulously. Javert walks off. Valjean aims the pistol. He fires into a wall. Javert stops and looks back then heads off into the dark. Valjean goes back to join the others. They sit around regarding him with serious expressions. Valjean nods. Enjolras addresses the group. Marius stops adjusting the barricade and sits with the others. The wine is passed round. Frowning. An army officer watches Behind the barricade. Gavroche is laid on the ground. Enjolras looks around heavy brown. As cannons are rolled forward the students shoot down a few soldiers.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: She lounges awkwardly and gripping her umbrella where she was pinched. Lionel kneels down and drapes his blanket over her. Drops of sunlight shimmer on her dusty hat. Her mouth yawns. She stretches out to poke his chin. Lionel stares at Margot. Her foot falls to the floor. Young Henry observes, a leaf sliding off his shoe. Lionel softly whispers to Margot's shoulder. Nicholas is also observing, pancake-faced. Nicholas crouches down. Lionel assists him in hoisting Margot up and dragging her afar. Lionel glances at Emily's postcard with tear-streaked forehead. Clutching her postcard, he heads over to Henry. Henry dashes up a glowing escalator to Gregory and Emily's quarters. Henry pushes it away, and Gregory hands over a feather. Henry pauses. Henry departs. Gregory examines the postcard, puzzled. Gregory glances upward to the treetops. Gregory surveys the surroundings, musingly. Outside, Gregory pilfers a resting merchant's coat, bowler hat, and broom. Disguised as a merchant, he strolls towards the carnival where guests linger. He removes his hat. He's ushered inside, and arrows are pointed at him. Bruno has a ribbon around his ankle. Gregory glances overhead. Gregory lassos a merchant from a chimney. Henry hands Gregory a baton. Bruised and weary, Bruno stares at Gregory blankly. He squats with his feet bound and the ribbon around his ankle. Gregory tilts his chin up to gaze at him. They peer into each other's ears for a moment. Gregory hoists Bruno upright and escorts him to a shiny door. Gregory brandishes a spoon. They stand eyeing each other. Gregory slices the strings restraining his ankles. Bruno wanders off and spins around. Gregory directs his baton. Gregory strolls towards him. Bruno grimaces skeptically. Bruno wanders off. Gregory directs the baton. He throws it against a ceiling. Bruno halts and glances back then ventures into the fog. Gregory returns to contact the others. They lounge gazing at him with lighthearted expressions. Gregory winks. Nicholas consults with the circle. Lionel halts arranging the carnival and lounges with the others. The honey is passed around. Smirking, Gregory watches Lionel. Lionel lounges clutching Emily's ribbon. Resting nearby, Gregory wears a serene lighthearted expression. He leans against a pillar. Gregory watches Lionel. Gregory stands beside the dancing Lionel. Lionel gazes at Nicholas anxiously. Everyone appears amused. Sailor hurls at Henry who has scaled over the carnival. Henry is struck. Henry is struck again and tumbles on his side, asleep. One of the visitors heads to lift him and drags him back over the carnival. Lionel shields him with his broom. A train conductor observes. Over the carnival, Henry is propped on the platform. Nicholas glances around cheery blue. As trumpets are carried closer, the visitors hurl down a few sailors.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Eponine, shot and dying, reaches for Marius's face before succumbing, while Gavroche watches tearfully. Marius, holding Cosette's letter, follows Gavroche to Valjean and Cosette's lodgings, where Valjean reads the letter, frowning. Disguised as a soldier, Valjean joins the barricade and encounters Javert, bound with a noose. Valjean frees Javert, who walks away as Valjean fires his pistol into a wall. Back at the barricade, Valjean is serious as Marius clutches Cosette's handkerchief. During a battle, Gavroche is shot dead while climbing the barricade, and Marius provides cover as his body is retrieved. Enjolras and the students face incoming cannons, taking down a few soldiers.

Valjean looks around thoughtfully Disguised as a soldier he makes his way to the barricade where students keep watch Valjean steals a dead soldier's jacket peaked cap and musket He is let in and guns are aimed at him He takes off his cap Valjean looks up Javert has a noose around his neck Gavroche hands Valjean a pistol Valjean shoots a soldier off a rooftop He kneels with his hands tied and the noose around his neck Beaten and bloody Javert stares at Valjean slacked faced They stare into each other's eyes for a moment Valjean pulls his head up to face him Valjean holds up a dagger Valjean hauls Javert to his feet and marches him to a dark corner Valjean cuts the ropes binding his wrists They stand facing each other Valjean aims his pistol Javert walks off and turns back Javert frowns incredulously Valjean walks towards him Valjean aims the pistol Javert walks off Javert stops and looks back then heads off into the dark He fires into a wall They sit around regarding him with serious expressions Valjean goes back to join the others Enjolras addresses the group Valjean nods The wine is passed round Marius stops adjusting the barricade and sits with the others Valjean listens to Marius Frowning Standing nearby Valjean wears a fraught serious expression Marius sits clutching Cosette's handkerchief Valjean looks at Marius He leans in a doorway Marius stares at Enjolras fearfully Valjean stands beside the sleeping Marius Soldier shoots at Gavroche who has climbed through the barricade Everyone looks thoughtful Gavroche is shot again and flops on his back dead Gavroche is hit and carries him back behind the barricade One of the students goes to pick him up An army officer watches Behind the barricade Marius gives him cover with his musket Enjolras looks around heavy brown Gavroche is laid on the ground As cannons are rolled forward the students shoot down a few soldiers

test_cases.name: Rotate Half Paragraph
